column4: so...I was in the middle of recording some music tracks, and my whole /home switched to read-only, and I cannot switch it back
has anyone heard of this problem?
sounds like system found error on /home partition and remounted read only, reboot from cd and fsck your drive
crap, this is the second time this has happened after wiping the disks
so, they are pretty much fried, huh?

I have a usb drive here that does the same thing from time to time, but it happens when drive is reading and usb polls another device, causing drive to pause. could be hardware, could be something to do with running processes
so, can I atleast recover my data that I currently have before the reboot
because a reboot will not even give me a shell, and a livecd will not allow me to tweak the partitions, I have tried numerous times
you should be able to, like i said boot from live cd, ie: knoppix and fsck the /home partition
I promise it won't work, I tried for the last two weeks
whatever you do, don't fsck mounted partition
bad things happen if you do
agreed, so...then it is impossible to get this data off, or what?
this is a re-recording of a track I lost last week because of the same problem
I REALLY don't want to redo it a third time
after fsck the partition from knoppix, reboot and see if it mounts correctly, if so i don't see why you couldn't recover it
here is the problem, knoppix and livecds crash when I try to use fdisk or gdisk after this GPT error
I tried a couple different versions, basically as soon as I shutdown, this is done, I lose it all
don't use fdisk, use fsck
that is what I meant
before I tinker, it is impossible to get the data off of the computer?
because last time I rebooted with a livecd, fsck, fdisk, gparted everything i tried would not deal with this mystery GPT partition that appears out of nowhere
doubtful, but then i'm not at console so i can't say for sure, more than likely the data will be recoverable
definitely not
